alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 12:47PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Elmore County through 130 PM MDT... At 1247 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cat Creek Summit, or 19 miles northeast of Mountain Home, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bennett Mountain around 1250 PM MDT. Little Camas Reservoir and Anderson Ranch Reservoir around 120 PM MDT. Anderson Dam around 130 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Anderson Ranch Reservoir, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
